alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 6:23PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Boyd, Lawrence, southeastern Lawrence, Cabell, northwestern Lincoln and Wayne Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 623 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Blaine, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Louisa, Wayne, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Barboursville, Kenova, Milton, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, Fort Gay, Webbville, Ona, Burnaugh, Martha, Durbin and Ulysses. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 188 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
